tool.name: lines_scs

param.name: in_Points
param.dialogReference: Input feature class containing points along hydrological network, generated from Procedural Features

param.name: out_Lines
param.dialogReference: Output line feature class representing Stream Conservation Units

param.name: in_downTrace
param.dialogReference: Network Analyst service layer set up to run downstream

param.name: in_upTrace
param.dialogReference: Network Analyst service layer set up to run upstream

param.name: in_tidalTrace
param.dialogReference: Network Analyst service layer set up to run both up- and downstream in tidal areas

param.name: fld_Tidal
param.dialogReference: In the Network Points layer, the name of the field indicating whether points are tidal or not

param.name: out_Scratch
param.dialogReference: A geodatabase for storing intermediate products. This only needs to be specified when debugging, or if running into computer memory issues.

tool.summary: Loads points associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network, traces upstream and downstream network segments using Network Analyst, and combines adjacent segments to create linear Stream Conservation Site lines.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Loads points associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network, gathers upstream and downstream network segments, and combines segments to create linear Stream Conservation Units (SCU).
